FAQ / Wave 2 / Battle Cards /
View On FortressMaximus.io

Cornered!

  1. Which cards do not 'work' on a character in Body mode?
    The following cards apply to Bot mode and thus will not affect an enemy character in its Body mode:
    - Cornered!
    - Marksmanship
    The following cards apply to Bot mode and thus will not affect one of your characters in its Body mode:
    - Cliffjumper - Renegade Warrior's Alt mode ability
    - Conversion Expertise (still provides Tough 1 in Alt mode)
    - Escape Route
    - Hit and Run
    - Hunker Down (still upgrades with Armor if the character with Body mode is currently a Tank)
    - Pop a Wheelie (if there was a Motorcycle with a Body mode, it would not flip)
    - Roll Out!
    - Start Your Engines (still untaps if the character with Body mode is currently a Car)
    - Swerve
    - Unconventional Flying Object
  2. If Cornered! were played on an Autobot Mirage, allowing a player to play an action during their opponent's turn, and they played an All-Out Attack; could they attack with all of their characters during their opponent's turn?
    No. A player cannot attack during an opponent’s turn.
  3. When I play Cornered! and force my opponent to flip one of their character's do they get to use a "when you flip to this mode” Ability on my turn?
    Yes. If you play Cornered! on an opponent’s character, they get to use a flip ability on that turn.
  4. If I play Cornered! on an opponent's Triple Changer, do they get to decide which Alt Mode it converts to?
    Yes.
  5. When I play Cornered! and force my opponent to flip one of their character's do they get to use a "when you flip to this mode” Ability on my turn?
    Yes. If you play Cornered! on an opponent’s character, they get to use a flip ability on that turn.
  6. Would Cornered work on a Battle Master causing it to flip to its upgrade side? If yes, what would happen to the upgrade?
    No, you can’t flip a Battle Master while it’s on the battlefield.
  7. Does Battering Ram function like Cornered! when attacking, so that your opponent gets the ability of the mode flipped to? For example, General Optimus Prime has Battering Ram and hits my Nemesis, flipping him to alt mode. So now my opponent should assign 2 damage to a character of his choice, correct?
    Yes. Battering Ram causes your opponent to flip the character, so abilities like Nemesis’ will trigger.
